3:
Boast in his holy name;
\q let the heart of those who seek Yahweh rejoice.
5:
Recall the marvelous things he has done,
\q his miracles and the decrees from his mouth,
\q
6:
you descendants of Abraham his servant,
\q you people of Jacob, his chosen ones.
7:
He is Yahweh, our God.
\q His decrees are on all the earth.
\q
8:
He keeps in mind his covenant forever,
\q the word that he commanded for a thousand generations.
9:
He calls to mind the covenant that he made with Abraham
\q and his oath to Isaac.
\q
10:
This is what he confirmed to Jacob as a statute
\q and to Israel as an everlasting covenant.
\q
11:
He said, "I will give you the land of Canaan
\q as your share of your inheritance."
12:
He said this when they were only few in number,
\q so very few, and were strangers in the land.
\q
13:
They went from nation to nation
\q and from one kingdom to another.
15:
He said, "Do not touch my anointed ones,
\q and do not harm my prophets."
17:
He sent a man ahead of them;
\q Joseph was sold as a servant.
19:
until the time his words came true,
\q and the word of Yahweh tested him.
21:
He put him in charge of his house
\q as ruler of all his possessions
\q
22:
to instruct his princes as he wished
\q and to teach his elders wisdom.
\q
23:
Then Israel came into Egypt,
\q and Jacob lived for a time in the land of Ham.
24:
Yahweh made his people fruitful,
\q and made them stronger than their enemies.
\q
25:
He caused their enemies to hate his people,
\q to mistreat his servants.
\q
26:
He sent Moses, his servant,
\q and Aaron, whom he had chosen.
\q
27:
They performed his signs among the Egyptians,
\q his wonders in the land of Ham.
28:
He sent darkness and made that land dark,
\q but its people did not obey his commands.
\q
29:
He turned their water into blood
\q and killed their fish.
\q
30:
Their land swarmed with frogs,
\q even in the rooms of their rulers.
31:
He spoke, and swarms of flies and gnats came
\q throughout their country.
\q
32:
He turned their rain into hail,
\q with fire flaming on their land.
\q
33:
He destroyed their vines and fig trees;
\q he broke the trees of their country.
34:
He spoke, and the locusts came,
\q so many locusts.
\q
36:
He killed every firstborn in their land,
\q the firstfruits of all their strength.
38:
Egypt was glad when they went away,
\q for the Egyptians were afraid of them.
\q
39:
He spread a cloud for a covering
\q and made a fire to light up the night.
40:
The Israelites asked for food, and he brought quail
\q and satisfied them with bread from heaven.
\q
42:
For he called to mind his holy promise
\q that he made to Abraham his servant.
43:
He led his people out with joy,
\q his chosen with shouts of triumph.
\q
45:
so that they might keep his statutes
\q and obey his laws.
\q Praise Yahweh.
